title: Exercise 1.2: Working with Variables and Types
description: Declare variables in both C and C++ to store course information, then output a formatted summary.

tests.name: cpp_outputs_all_fields
tests.description: Program should print the complete course summary for the C++ variant
tests.expected:
Course: TSI C++ Essentials
Seats: 24
Pass Rate: 92.3
Has Lab: yes

tests.name: cpp_includes_pass_rate
tests.description: Output should mention the pass rate

hints: Use #include <string> to work with std::string in C++
Store booleans using bool and convert them to yes/no text before printing
Remember to use std::cout with std::endl for each line
Match the exact output labels shown in the example

variants.title: Exercise 1.2A: Variables in C

tests.name: c_outputs_all_fields
tests.description: Program should print the complete student summary for the C variant
tests.expected:
Students: 28
Average Score: 91.5
Top Grade: A
Accredited: true

tests.name: c_mentions_average
tests.description: Output should include the precise average score

hints: Remember to include <stdbool.h> to use bool in C
Use printf with %d, %f, and %c for int, double, and char values
Convert the boolean to the words true/false before printing
Follow the exact capitalization for each label
